intro: Hieracium solidagineum subsp. abadesicola, commonly known as the Abadesicola hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces yellow flowers in late summer, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other members of the Hieracium genus.
